column4: Guys I have windows vista and windows 7 installed in my system, but grub bootloader only sees the vista one, what cna i do?
you will need to add an entry in /boot/grub/menu.lst to boot the other OS
im alreayd viewing the file, just dont know which..... well my vista entry has this in it (hd0,0) idk what my win 7 is, maybe (hd0,10?
the entry that boots the vista is pretty much what you need but the partition used will be different
if you only have 1 disk, the first number will always be 0
if you read the output of: sudo fdisk -l  you will see what partition number (you will need to subtract 1 as grub numbers start at 0 and linux start numbers at 1)
make an extra entry and you can try it, if it boots, great, if not, boot to Ubuntu and re-edit
assuming sda is the first disk according to grub
if you only have a single disk, the answer is definately yes
don't worry if its wrong it wont break anything, just that entry won't boot anything
why do you need vista and 7 installed?
or sudo nano /boot/grub/menu.lst   if you prefer nano, etc
i have such a wierd error
